poem:
**Ethics in the Long Grass**

In the corridors, whispers flicker,  
promises shuffle in delay—  
a watchdog, unseen,  
lost in parliamentary haze.  

Scrutiny nudges  
but shadows lengthen  
ever silent,  
past the daisies' patient wait.  

In the field's quiet sway,  
we wait—  
ethics tangled  
in the green.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Keir Starmer facing scrutiny over failure to establish new ethics watchdog No 10 is facing scrutiny over its failure to bring in a new ethics watchdog almost a year after the election, as a new inquiry was launched to examine the seeming lack of progress. Amid signs that the plans have been kicked into the long grass, parliament’s public administration committee said it was launching an inquiry to push the government on what has happened". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Keir Starmer facing scrutiny over failure to establish new ethics watchdog No 10 is facing scrutiny over its failure to bring in a new ethics watchdog almost a year after the election, as a new inquiry was launched to examine the seeming lack of progress. Amid signs that the plans have been kicked into the long grass, parliament’s public administration committee said it was launching an inquiry to push the government on what has happened
